content.intro_para: Teenage girls just want to hang out, be with their friends, carelessly hook up with boys and go to "futbol" matches. Adults, always middling in their lives is just another obstacle to overcome to emerge as young, independent women. The teenage girls from Mustang, however, also have a different approach to marriage than their adoptive family is used to; they want to choose whom to marry. They want to have freedom to leave their village, the freedom to an education and the freedom to act their age. The story follows a trajectory that is reminiscing of other, feel-good, empowering women stories, however, the storytelling is what sets it apart. The female perspective is strong, very personal, and follows the girls from carefree fun to downfall.
